sanskrit_verse:
संयोगं पतितैर्गत्वा परस्यैव च योषितम् ।
अपहृत्य च विप्रस्वं भवति ब्रह्मराक्षसः ॥ १२.६०॥
transliteration:
saṃyogaṃ patitair gatvā parasyaiva ca yositam |
apahṛtya ca viprasyaṃ bhavati braharākṣasaḥ || 12.60||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who engages in union with a woman fallen from her husband's protection, and having taken away the wealth of a Brahmin, becomes a Brahma-rakshasa.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from alignment with Dharma, not possession or status
Causation rooted in violation of sacred trust and energetic boundary
Capacity-based responsibility determined by consciousness distortion level
Restoration logic demands purification and realignment to source integrity
Consciousness alignment requires dissolution of distorted identity-formations
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent accesses protected relational field without consent AND removes consecrated assets THEN invoke consciousness quarantine protocol
IF entity assumes unauthorized conjugal proximity WHILE violating Brahminic economic sovereignty THEN initiate karmic frequency reset sequence
IF individual transgresses spousal sanctity domain THEN disallow participation in dharmic governance structures until purification completion
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, this verse establishes that violations involving sacred relational boundaries and consecrated resources result in automatic loss of juridical standing. The court must recognize such acts as fundamental disruptions to cosmic order, requiring restoration through prescribed spiritual protocols rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causal disruption arises from misaligned intentionality, not external action alone. Anupūrvaśaḥ demonstrates sequential descent into distortion when sacred boundaries are violated. Responsibility aligns proportionally with awareness at time of act. Non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering cannot restore dharma; only conscious reintegration achieves lawful balance.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Vedic Fire Ritual (Agnihotra) for energetic purification
Assign recitation of specific Purusha Sukta mantras for vibrational recalibration
Enforce temporary isolation from societal decision-making roles
Undertake ritual restitution to affected parties under priestly supervision
Complete Tapasya under qualified Guru for full consciousness realignment
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of all Dharma. This ruling restores cosmic equilibrium through consciousness-centered justice. There is no punishment—only purification. Dharma prevails through awakened awareness. Reality responds solely to inner transformation.
